pkgmetadata.longdescription: Django Facebook Graph API=========================[![PyPI version](https://badge.fury.io/py/django-facebook-api.png)](http://badge.fury.io/py/django-facebook-api) [![Build Status](https://travis-ci.org/ramusus/django-facebook-api.png?branch=master)](https://travis-ci.org/ramusus/django-facebook-api) [![Coverage Status](https://coveralls.io/repos/ramusus/django-facebook-api/badge.png?branch=master)](https://coveralls.io/r/ramusus/django-facebook-api)Application for interacting with Facebook Graph API objects using Django model interfaceInstallation------------ pip install django-facebook-apiAdd into `settings.py` lines: INSTALLED_APPS = ( ... 'oauth_tokens', 'facebook-api', ) # oauth-tokens settings OAUTH_TOKENS_HISTORY = True # to keep in DB expired access tokens OAUTH_TOKENS_FACEBOOK_CLIENT_ID = '' # application ID OAUTH_TOKENS_FACEBOOK_CLIENT_SECRET = '' # application secret key OAUTH_TOKENS_FACEBOOK_SCOPE = ['offline_access'] # application scopes OAUTH_TOKENS_FACEBOOK_USERNAME = '' # user login OAUTH_TOKENS_FACEBOOK_PASSWORD = '' # user passwordUsage examples--------------### Simple API Graph request >>> from facebook_api.api import api_call >>> api_call('4') {u'first_name': u'Mark', u'id': u'4', u'last_name': u'Zuckerberg', u'link': u'https://www.facebook.com/app_scoped_user_id/10101334100533631/', u'name': u'Mark Zuckerberg', u'updated_time': u'2015-09-29T14:42:17+0000'} >>> api_call('4', fields='id,name') {u'id': u'4', u'name': u'Mark Zuckerberg'}Licensing---------This library uses the [Apache License, version 2.0](http://www.apache.org/licenses/LICENSE-2.0.html). Please see the library's individual files for more information.
